Title: Justin Woodson & Hawaii Lawmakers & Leadership: Increase Resources & Support The Filmmaking Industry On Maui
Overview:
Maui is ready to become the next major film location in the filmmaking industry.
With the combination of a 25 percent tax credit incentive the largest film and television production sound stage in the state of Hawaii an annual film festival location vehicles and countless breathtaking locations and views for the first time in history Maui is in a perfect position to accommodate year round film & TV production.

Maui county industry leaders need to come together to collaborate and aggressively move the film industry forward. Resources need to organized and put into action to make Maui as "production friendly" as possible. Every available avenue needs to be taken to showcase Mauis film assets on a competitive level with all the major USA production hubs.

Tracy Bennett has the credentials experience and Hollywood connections to move the Maui film industry forward yet he is in need of increased resources and support from Maui leadership to create a foundation from which to showcase all the possibilities Maui has to offer. Revenues from Maui film production will create thousands of jobs and increase productivity island wide. There are over 1 000 film industry professionals that live here on Maui and are ready to work. Local bushiness like hotels resorts restaurants and countless others will also increase their revenues throughout the calender year.

Maui Mayor AlanArakawa is quoted in The Hollywood Reporter magazine last year (June 14th) "We support all efforts to try and expand our film industry here in Maui County because we have always felt that this could be a new economic engine for us."

The time is now to make this a reality!

Sign the petition and make a difference NOW!
Letter Body: Increase Resources & Support The Filmmaking Industry On Maui
